SEARCH
Package de.fherfurt.clevercash.api.controller

Klasse TransactionController

java.lang.Object
de.fherfurt.clevercash.api.controller.TransactionController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/transactions") public class TransactionController extends Object
Controller class for managing operations related to transactions associated with bank accounts. Provides endpoints for retrieving and adding transactions. Handles HTTP requests and interacts with the TransactionService to perform operations on transactions. Ensures that access control is enforced using AuthenticationService.

Endpoints available in this controller:

  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/transactions - Retrieve a list of transactions with optional filters such as date range, transaction type, and description.
  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/transactions/{transactionID} - Retrieve a specific transaction by its ID.
  • POST /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/transactions - Add a new transaction to a bank account.

Handles exceptions and returns appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages for various error conditions:

  • 400 Bad Request - When request parameters or body are invalid.
  • 403 Forbidden - When the user does not have the required permissions.
  • 404 Not Found - When the requested resource (user, bank account, or transaction) is not found.
Autor:
Richard Prax, Jakob Roch

  • Methodendetails

    • findTransactions

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<?>> findTransactions(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @RequestParam(required=false) String startDate, @RequestParam(required=false) String endDate, @RequestParam(required=false) String transactionType, @RequestParam(required=false) String description, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves transactions for a specific user and bank account with optional filters.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user whose transactions are to be retrieved
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account to filter transactions for
      startDate - optional start date of the period to filter transactions (inclusive), in the format yyyy-MM-dd
      endDate - optional end date of the period to filter transactions (inclusive), in the format yyyy-MM-dd
      transactionType - optional type of transaction to filter by
      description - optional substring to filter transactions by their description
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the list of filtered transactions, or an appropriate error status if an exception occurs

    • findTransactionByID

      @GetMapping(path="/{transactionID}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findTransactionByID(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @PathVariable int transactionID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves a specific transaction for a given bank account.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user who owns the bank account
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account
      transactionID - the ID of the transaction to retrieve
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the requested transaction or an appropriate HTTP status code

    • addTransactionToBankAccount

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addTransactionToBankAccount(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @RequestBody NewTransactionDTO newTransactionDTO, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Adds a new transaction to a specific bank account.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user who owns the bank account
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account to which the transaction will be added
      newTransactionDTO - the transaction to be added to the bank account
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated bank account or an appropriate HTTP status code
